description: Unique identifier for an observation record for a person.
comment: Primary Key for the OBSERVATION table.

description: Unique identifier for the person associated with the observation.
Standard concept mapped from the source value representing an observation.
Date of the observation (e.g., date of lab test, survey, or family history recording).
Datetime of the observation. Convention is to set time to midnight if unavailable.
Concept ID representing the provenance of the observation record (e.g., EHR, claims).
Numerical value of the observation result, if applicable.
Categorical value of the observation result, if applicable.
Concept ID representing a categorical result of the observation.
Concept ID representing additional attributes specifying the observation (e.g., degrees, severities).
Concept ID representing the unit of the observation, if applicable.
Provider associated with the observation record (e.g., ordering or recording provider).
Visit during which the observation occurred.
Visit Detail during which the observation occurred.
Verbatim value from the source data representing the observation.
Concept ID representing the observation source value, not necessarily standard.
Verbatim value from the source data representing the unit of the observation.
comment: Source-provided unit value for the observation.

description: Verbatim value from the source data representing the qualifier of the observation.
comment: Source-provided qualifier value for the observation.

description: Verbatim result value of the observation from the source data.
comment: Source-provided result value for the observation.

description: Primary key of the linked record related to the observation, if applicable.
Concept ID identifying the table and field the linked record belongs to.
